div.l: Wel hath thys Myleer vernysshed hys hed
Ful pale he was for dronke ‚Åäand nat red
He yexith and he spekith thorow the nose
As he were in the quacke or on the pose
To bedde he goth and wyth hym goth hys wyf
As ony Iay was she lyght and Iolyf
So was her Ioly whystyl wel y wet
The cradyl at here beddis feet was fet
To rocken aud to yeue the chylde sowke
And when that dawkyn was in the crowke
To bedde wente the doughter right anone
To bedde goth aleyn and also Iohn
Ther nas nomore ther nedyth hem no dwale
Thys myller hath so wysely bibbed ale
That as an hors he fnortith and slepe
Ne of hys tayl behynde he toke no kepe
Hys wyf bare hym a burdon a ful strong
Men myghte here rowtyng heren a furlong
The wenche rowted eke par company
Aleyn the clerk that herde thys melody
He pokyd Iohn and sayd slepist thou
Herdist thou euyr slyke a song or now
Lo whylk a coplynge is atwene hem alle
A wylde fyre vp on her bodyys falle
Who herde euyr swylk a ferly thyng
Ye they shal haue the flour of yll endyng
Thys longe nyght ther tyd me no reste
But yet noforce al shal be for the best
For Iohn sayd aleyn al so mot I thryue
If that I may yon wenche wol I swyue
Som esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a lawe that sayth thus
That yf a man in o thyng be agreued
That in anothyr he shal be releued
Our corn is stole sothly hyt is no nay
And we haue had an euyl fytte to day
And syn I shal hane non amendement
Ageyns my losse I wol haue esement
